title: Temporal Landscapes: A Graphical Logic of Behavior. (arXiv:1904.01081v2 [math.LO] UPDATED)
description: We present an elementary introduction to a new logic for reasoning about behaviors that occur over time. This logic is based on temporal type theory. The syntax of the logic is similar to the usual first-order logic; what differs is the notion of truth value. Instead of reasoning about whether formulas are true or false, our logic reasons about temporal landscapes. A temporal landscape may be thought of as representing the set of durations over which a statement is true. To help understand the practical implications of this approach, we give a wide variety of examples where this logic is used to reason about autonomous agents.
dc:creator: Brendan Fong (Topos Institute), Alberto Speranzon (Honeywell Aerospace), David I. Spivak (Topos Institute & MIT LIDS)
